div.ab:
لى پسم الله الرحمن الرّحپم
يتسلّم الشّيخ إبراهيم بن أبو مفرّج رحمه اللّه من عبد عبد الشّيخ
حسن التّاجر السكندري صحبة مفلح غلام
العريف حملين كتّان أربع قطع
والسّلام

bi smi ăl lāhi ăr raḥmāni ăr raḥīmi
yatasallami ăš šayḫu ʾibrāhīmu bnu ʾabū mufarriǧ:in raḥima hu ăl lāhu min ʿabdi ʿindi ăš šayḫi
ḥasan:ini ăt tāǧiri ăli skandariyyi ṣuḥbaẗa mufliḥ:in ġulāmi
ăl ʿarīfi ḥimlayni kattān ʾarbaʿa qiṭaʿ:in
wa ăs salāmu

In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate.
Shaykh Ibrāhīm, the son of Abū Mufarrij - may God have mercy on him! - is to receive from Shaykh
Ḥasan, the merchant of Alexandria, accompanied by Mufliḥ, the young slave boy Ḥasan, the merchant of Alexandria, accompanied by Mufliḥ, the young slave boy (ghulām)
of the superintendent (al-ʿarīf), two loads of flax (kattān) [in] four bundles (qitaʿ). of the superintendent, two loads of flax [in] four bundles.
Peace. Peace [be upon you].
